title: Synthetic Recap
body:
HOUSTON (AP) – On a night where the final score suggested a team victory, the Toyota Center bore witness to a singular, historic force of nature named Hakeem Olajuwon. The Houston Rockets defeated the Dallas Mavericks 100-87, but this was not merely a game; it was a masterclass, an artistic display of dominance orchestrated entirely by "The Dream."

Olajuwon was simply unguardable, pouring in a staggering 43 points. He wasn't just scoring; he was dismantling the Mavericks' defense with an array of his signature, balletic post moves, turning the painted area into his personal canvas. Every drop-step, every fadeaway jumper was a lesson in basketball virtuosity. The Mavericks, with no answer for his brilliance, could only watch and foul, sending Olajuwon to the line 20 times, where he converted 17 attempts.

His supporting cast played their roles to perfection, feeding the beast in the middle. Clyde Drexler, the perfect sidekick, orchestrated the offense with 10 assists while adding 13 points. Charles Barkley provided the muscle with 14 rebounds. But this was Olajuwon’s symphony. He also corralled 12 rebounds to complete a powerful double-double, a testament to his all-around dominance on a night he owned from the opening tip.

For Dallas, a 22-point, 11-assist effort from Michael Finley was rendered a mere footnote in the face of Olajuwon’s onslaught. The Mavericks fought, but they were ultimately overmatched by a legendary performance for the ages. The record books will show a Rockets win, but the memory will forever be of one man, Hakeem Olajuwon, reaching a plane few ever inhabit and delivering a night of pure, unadulterated basketball greatness.
